    • Method Detail

      • searchAndRunMethod

        public static boolean searchAndRunMethod(java.lang.Class<?> cl,
                                         java.lang.Object target,
                                         java.lang.String prefix,
                                         java.lang.String key,
                                         java.lang.Object value,
                                         boolean keyIsParameter)
        Search a method w/one arg. This will search for a method whose name is constructed from arguments. If found, runs it.
        Parameters:
        cl - the class used to search for method
        target - the target object to apply method on
        prefix - the prefix for method (like 'set' or 'add') or null for no prefix. If key is null, the method name will be 'prefix()'.
        key - the key containing the core method name. If a prefix exists, the name will be 'prefixKey()'. If prefix is null, the name is 'key()'.
        value - the value to give to the method.
        keyIsParameter - true if the key is parameter
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • applyGetAndAddMethod

        public static boolean applyGetAndAddMethod(java.lang.Class<?> cl,
                                           java.lang.Object target,
                                           java.lang.String key,
                                           java.lang.Object value)
        Apply getKEYs().yyy() method chain.
        Parameters:
        cl - the class used to search for method
        target - the target object to apply the getKEYs() method on
        key - the key containing the KEY method name part. it will be converted with first character in uppercase
        value - the value to give to the method.
        Returns:
        true, if successful

        Returns:

        Search for a method.
        Parameters:

        methName - the method name
        nbParms - the number of parameters
        Returns:
        true, if successful

                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.Object> objects)
